name: The Eviction Lab at Princeton University
description: The Eviction Lab at Princeton University creates data, interactive tools, and research to help neighbors and policymakers understand the eviction crisis.

SDGs.evidenceText: Eviction is both a cause and a consequence of poverty, and addressing the eviction crisis can help in efforts to reduce poverty.
Eviction in the USA disproportionately affects people of color; therefore addressing the crisis is a way of targeting one aspect of structural inequality in this country.
Because landlords are often highly advantaged in eviction cases, The Eviction Lab advocates for equal representation in courts for tenants facing eviction.

organizations.name: The Eviction Lab at Princeton University
